articles.author: SARAH EL DEEB and SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: BEIRUT (AP) — Israel said late Monday it planned to carry out more strikes in Lebanon against a Hezbollah-run financial institution that it targeted the night before and which it says uses customers' deposits to finance attacks against Israel.
articles.title: Israel says more strikes are coming against a Hezbollah-run financial institution

articles.author: AAMER MADHANI and DAVID KLEPPER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden is “deeply concerned” about the unauthorized release of classified documents on Israel's preparation for a potential retaliatory attack on Iran, a White House spokesman said Monday.
articles.title: Biden is 'deeply concerned' about the release of secret documents on Israel's possible attack plans

articles.author: BASSEM MROUE
articles.description: BEIRUT (AP) — The Israeli military has carried out a wave of airstrikes targeting branches of a financial institution affiliated with Lebanon’s Hezbollah, saying the quasi-banking system is being used to fund the militant group's military wing.
articles.title: What is the Hezbollah-linked financial institution Israel is targeting in Lebanon?

articles.author: MICHELLE L. PRICE and BILL BARROW
articles.description: SWANNANOA, N.C. (AP) — Surveying storm damage in North Carolina, former President Donald Trump on Monday blasted federal emergency responders whose work has been stymied by armed harassment and a deluge of misinformation, but he said he was not concerned that the aftermath of Hurricane Helene would affect election results in the battleground state.
articles.title: Trump makes more debunked claims about FEMA as he surveys storm damage in North Carolina

articles.author: AMANDA SEITZ
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Millions of people with private health insurance would be able to pick up over-the-counter methods like condoms, the “morning after” pill and birth control pills for free under a new rule the White House proposed on Monday.
articles.title: White House says health insurance needs to fully cover condoms, other over-the-counter birth control

articles.author: ANDREA RODRIGUEZ and MILEXSY DURAN
articles.description: HAVANA (AP) — Cuba's capital was largely paralyzed on Monday and the rest of the island braced for the fourth night of a massive blackout that has generated a handful of small protests and a stern government warning that any unrest will be punished.
articles.title: Cubans struggle with an extended power outage and a new tropical storm

articles.author: RUSS BYNUM and EMILY WAGSTER PETTUS
articles.description: SAVANNAH, Ga. (AP) — The metal gangway where dozens of people waited to board a ferry boat made a loud, creaking noise before snapping in the middle amid panicked cries from those sent plunging into the water.
articles.title: Eyewitness video captures frantic efforts to save lives after deadly collapse of dock walkway

articles.author: ISABEL DEBRE
articles.description: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina (AP) — An initial toxicology report for ex-One Direction singer Liam Payne, who died last week after falling from a third-floor hotel balcony in Buenos Aires, showed that he had cocaine in his system after his death, an Argentine official said.
articles.title: Initial report shows Liam Payne had cocaine in his system when he died, says Argentine official

articles.author: JOHN SEEWER
articles.description: The family of Jayland Walker, a Black man killed when eight police officers fired 94 bullets at him after he shot at least one round out his car window, will receive a $4.8 million settlement from the city of Akron, the mayor's office said Monday.
articles.title: Akron to pay $4.8 million to relatives of a Black man killed by police

articles.author: RONALD BLUM
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Broadway vs. Hollywood. Subway vs. Freeway. Judge vs. Ohtani.New York neighbors who became cross-country rivals, the Yankees and Dodgers renew their starry struggle in the World Series for the first time in 43 years.
articles.title: Yankees and Dodgers meet in World Series for 12th time in matchup of Broadway and Hollywood
